* [[w:Shao-Jiang Min|Shaojiang Min]] ([[w:Jiangle dialect|Jiangle]]): ʃi{{sup|8}}

subSections.title: Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text:
* Cantonese, Hakka, and Min regularly use {{lang|zh|食}} to mean “to eat” (for Min, see also Etymologies 3 and 4), whereas Mandarin uses {{zh-l|吃}}.
* Mandarin uses {{zh-l|吸}} for “to smoke”.

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{†}} {{zh-original|飼|to [[feed]]; to make ... eat or cause ... to eat}}

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|alt=吃,呷,噍}}
Unlikely to be related to Etymology 1 ({{zh-ref|Norman, 1991}}, {{zh-ref|Klöter, 2005}}, {{zh-ref|Fuehrer and Yang, 2014}}).  {{zh-ref|Kwok (2018)}} reconstructs Proto-Southern-Min {{m|nan|*tsiaʔ⁸}},<!-- Proto-Southern-Min does not yet have a language code --> and tentatively reconstructs Proto-Min {{m|zhx-min-pro|*dziak}}.  {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} suggests it derives from {{och-l|嚼|tr=Later Han: *dziak}}.

subSections.title: Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text: * This etymon is often taken as the vernacular counterpart to Etymology 1.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text: uka + i → uke<sub>2</sub> → uke. Bound apophonic form {{m|ja|食|tr=uka}}.

subSections.title: Noun
